main event: Six yellow-orange objects were observed flying due south over Toledo, Ohio on October 6, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 15 minutes with no sound., The objects first appeared to travel across the sky from horizon to horizon and then stopped moving., The observers were riding in a car and stopped to view the objects clearly., Observers included 2 civilians and 1 military person., The edges of the objects appeared fuzzy and they seemed to be trailing fire.
witness description: 2 civilians and 1 military person riding in a car
